Package de.lases.business.service

Class SubmissionService

java.lang.Object
de.lases.business.service.SubmissionService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
@Dependent public class SubmissionService extends Object implements Serializable
Provides functionality regarding the management and handling of submissions. In case of an unexpected state, a UIMessage event will be fired.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

      public SubmissionService()

  • Method Details

    • getSubmission

      public Submission getSubmission​(Submission submission)
      Gets a submission.
      Parameters:
      submission - A Submission-DTO containing a valid id.
      Returns:
      The submission's data.

    • createSubmission

      public void createSubmission​(Submission submission, ScientificForum forum, List<User> reviewers, List<User> coauthors)
      Creates a new submission.

      The selected editor, reviewers and co-authors are informed about this using the EmailUtil utility. Do not forget to also add a paper using PaperService.addPaper(File, Submission).
      Parameters:
      submission - The submissions' data.
      forum - The forum where the submission is made.
      reviewers - The desired reviewers as proper User-DTOs or exclusively containing an email-address.
      coauthors - The desired co-athors as proper User-DTOs or exclusively containing an email-address.

    • removeSubmission

      public void removeSubmission​(Submission submission)
      Deletes a submission.
      Parameters:
      submission - A Submission-DTO containing a valid id.

    • changeSubmission

      public void changeSubmission​(Submission newSubmission)
      Manipulates a submission
      Parameters:
      newSubmission - A Submission-DTO filled with the fields that are desired to be changed.

      All fields filled with legal values will be overwritten, the rest are ignored. It should contain an existing id value.

    • setState

      public void setState​(Submission submission)
      Sets the state of a submission.

      The submitter and all co-authors are informed about an accept or reject decision by email using the EmailUtil utility.
      Parameters:
      submission - The Submission-DTO with a valid state.

    • setEditor

      public void setEditor​(Submission submission)
      Sets the editor of a submission.

      When changed, the new editor is informed by email using the EmailUtil utility.
      Parameters:
      submission - The Submission-DTO with a valid editor.

    • addReviewer

      public void addReviewer​(Submission submission, User reviewer, ReviewedBy reviewedBy)
      Adds a reviewer to a submission.

      If successful the reviewer is informed by email using the EmailUtil utility.
      Parameters:
      submission - The submission, that receives a new reviewer.
      reviewer - The reviewer to be added to the submission.
      reviewedBy - Information about the review-request relationship.

    • getReviewedBy

      public ReviewedBy getReviewedBy​(Submission submission, User reviewer)
      Gets the ReviewedBy-DTO for a submission and a reviewer. Therefore, gets whether a reviewer has accepted to review a submission and the reviews' deadline.
      Parameters:
      submission - The submission which is requested to be reviewed by a reviewer.
      reviewer - The requested reviewer for a submission.
      Returns:
      The ReviewedBy-DTO containing information about the review-request relationship of a submission and the reviewer. Returns null if no such relationship exists.

    • removeReviewer

      public void removeReviewer​(Submission submission, User reviewer)
      Removes a reviewer.

      If successful the reviewer is informed by email using the EmailUtil utility.
      Parameters:
      submission - The submission, that loses a reviewer.
      reviewer - The reviewer to be removed from the submission.

    • realeaseReview

      public void realeaseReview​(Review review, Submission submission)
      Releases a review to be viewed by the submitter.
      Parameters:
      review - The review to be released.
      submission - The submission containing that review.

    • addCoAuthor

      public void addCoAuthor​(Submission submission, User coAuthor)
      Adds a co-author.
      Parameters:
      coAuthor - The co-author to be added. This can be a regular User-DTO or exclusively contain an email address.
      submission - The submission, that receives a new co-author.

    • canView

      public boolean canView​(Submission submission, User user)
      Determines whether a user has permission to view a submission
      Parameters:
      submission - The submission to be viewed.
      user - The user whose view access is being determined.
      Returns:
      true if the view access is allowed, false otherwise.

    • getSubmissions

      public List<Submission> getSubmissions​(Privilege privilege, User user, ResultListParameters resultParams)
      Delivers all submissions, that a user has submitted, is an editor to or reviews.
      Parameters:
      privilege - The role, to which submissions belong, in relation to a user. Meaning, the user can request to receive the submissions which he is an editor to, reviews or has submitted himself.
      user - The user, whose editorial, reviewed or own and coauthored submissions.
      resultParams - The parameters, that control filtering and sorting of the resulting list.
      Returns:
      The resulting list of submissions, which a user is involved in.
